direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve adding elements to the composite set, but 'addAll' adds a collection of elements.
Both methods handle the addition of elements to the composite set, but 'addComposited' specifically adds another set to the composite.
Both methods modify the composite set, but 'remove' removes an element instead of adding it.
Both methods involve modifying the composite set by removing elements, but 'removeAll' removes a collection of elements.
Both methods modify the composite set, but 'retainAll' retains only the elements in the specified collection.
Both methods modify the composite set, but 'clear' removes all elements.
Both methods interact with the composite set, but 'contains' checks for the presence of an element instead of modifying the set.
Both methods interact with the composite set, but 'containsAll' checks for the presence of all elements in a collection.
Both methods interact with the composite set, but 'isEmpty' checks if the set is empty.
Both methods interact with the composite set, but 'size' returns the number of elements in the set.
